articles.author: Peter Kim Frank
articles.description:
Our friends at Bolt just officially kicked off the World's Largest Hackathon, an awesome competition with over $1,000,000 in prizes!
We love that this hackathon is breaking down barriers and welcoming new participants into the ecosystem.  If you‚Äôre not yet familiar with Bolt, it‚Äôs a powerful AI-platform that enables anyone with an idea to build production-ready applications without traditional coding skills. 
Whether you're a seasoned developer or a first-time entrepreneur with a vision, we hope you give this hackathon a try! 
Click the link below for all the details on how to get started.
Join the World's Largest Hackathon


Fun Fact: Everyone who signs up for the hackathon will receive a builder pack with thousands of credits to different services - AI voice, UI gen, infra, you name it!
Check out the Hackathon Kickoff Video: 









  
  
  Community Support


The main Hackathon entry process will take place via DevPost, but we‚Äôll be supporting the World‚Äôs Largest Hackathon in a variety of ways!
Starting next week, we'll be simulcasting as many hackathon-related livestreams as possible directly on the DEV homepage. Here are the first three sessions:
Domain Expertise with Entri - June 2, 2025 at 9:00AM PT
So what is an API anyways? With Pica - June 3, 2025 at 9:00AM PT


Building Conversational Video Agents with Tavus and Bolt - June 4, 2025 at 9:00AM PT
@jess will be bringing her judging experience from DEV Challenges to the event and will be serving as an official judge for the hackathon! She can't wait to check out all the innovative projects that emerge from this event.
We'll also be launching a writing contest specifically for World‚Äôs Largest Hackathon participants later this month, so stay tuned for details on how you can share your building journey and compete for exclusive DEV badges!
What are you planning to build? Drop a comment and let the community know! üëá
articles.title: Join the World's Largest Hackathon: $1 Million in Prizes üí∏

articles.author: sperez927
articles.description:
üö´ Problem: AntD Tables Aren‚Äôt Fast By Default Ant Design is a solid UI framework ‚Äî until you throw large datasets into its default table. We were rendering 300+ rows in a dashboard. Scroll lag, janky performance, and heavy DOM loads kicked in fast. It looked good‚Ä¶ but felt broken. react-window We swapped out the AntD component and replaced it with a react-window virtualized list. The trick? Keep using AntD‚Äôs column logic to retain the look and feel. import { FixedSizeList as List } from 'react-window'; const Row = ({ index, style }) => (
{renderRow(data[index])}
); {Row} This gave us: Consistent UI Way fewer DOM nodes Smooth scrolling even with big datasets üìä Results ~90% fewer DOM nodes Scroll FPS doubled Page feel instant again üí° Takeaway üîß Bonus Tips Use rowKey in tables to prevent re-renders Don't render hidden columns Profile performance in Chrome -> DevTools -> Performance üîó Resources react-window https://ant.design/components/table/
articles.title: AntD Tables Lag? Try This One Simple Virtualization Fix

articles.author: Suliman Munawar khan
articles.description:
Hi there! üëã I‚Äôm thrilled to share a new project I‚Äôve been working on ‚Äî it‚Äôs called CloudIdeaGeneration. üå•Ô∏è This web app helps you come up with interesting cloud project ideas that match your cloud provider, your skill level, and the services you‚Äôre curious about. Let me walk you through how it all works!
üåü Why I Built It
‚ÄúWhat if I had a tool that could suggest cloud projects tailored to my experience and the services I want to learn?‚Äù
That‚Äôs exactly what CloudIdeaGeneration does!
üí° How It Works
For example, if you‚Äôre just starting with Azure and want to learn about Azure Functions and Blob Storage, it‚Äôll give you beginner-friendly project ideas you can build right away!
üî• Features You‚Äôll Love
üåà Easy Selection
üåà Detailed Project Plans
A catchy title and clear description
Difficulty rating
Estimated time to build
High-level implementation steps
Cost insights with links to official pricing
Stretch goals if you want to take it further
Alternative services you can explore
üåà Modern & Responsive UI
üåà Dark Mode Ready
üõ†Ô∏è How It‚Äôs Built
Frontend: Angular
Backend: Node.js and Express
Security: CORS protection, rate limiting, and secure headers with Helmet
APIs: Use either OpenAI or Gemini to power the project suggestions.
To keep everything clean and scalable, I separated the app into two repos:
Frontend
Backend
üöÄ Where to Find It
CloudIdeaGeneration App
Just select your options and click ‚ÄúGenerate Ideas‚Äù ‚Äî you‚Äôll get three tailored project ideas every time!
üí≠ Final Thoughts
I‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts!
Your feedback will help me keep refining and expanding CloudIdeaGeneration so it can be as helpful as possible for everyone in the cloud community.
If you‚Äôre learning cloud tech, give it a try and let me know what you think!
And if you‚Äôre curious, check out the source code on GitHub and feel free to contribute.
articles.title: üöÄ Bringing Cloud Ideas to Life: My AI-Powered Project Idea Generator

articles.author: Charpie
articles.description:
Vite fam, we just launched a new open-source Vite + React template that makes it easy to integrate search into any web app using Searchcraft, our Rust-powered, developer-first search engine built for frontend teams.
If you‚Äôve ever struggled with search integrations that feel like setting up a data center, this is for you.
Use the template via GitHub or degit from the command line:
npx degit searchcraft-inc/vite-react-searchcraft-template <app_name>

Sign up at Searchcraft.io (free)
Plug in your API key and start building!
We‚Äôd love your feedback: PRs, issues, and stars welcome!
articles.title: Plug-and-Play Search with React + Vite

articles.author: Genildo Cerqueira Souza
articles.description:
A deep dive into how the partnership between developer and Artificial Intelligence transformed a weeks-long project into hours
Recently, I embarked on an ambitious project: creating a complete dashboard for project and task management. What would traditionally take weeks of solo development was completed in a matter of hours thanks to strategic collaboration with AI. This article explores not only the technical outcome, but primarily how the synergy between human experience and AI computational capability can revolutionize software development.

Home dashboard
The developed dashboard is a modern and complete web application, built with the following technologies:
Frontend:
React 18 with modern hooks
Vite as build tool and dev server
Tailwind CSS 3 for styling
React Router for navigation
Lu‚Ä¶
articles.title: üöÄ How I Built a Complete Project Dashboard in Hours with AI: A New Paradigm for Developers

articles.author: WI$DOM
articles.description:
My Tech Origin Story


Hey folks, Let me take you to where it all began. Here's a piece of my journey, raw and real.
We all have an origin story in tech, and NO! mine didn‚Äôt involve a hoodie, dark terminal screen, and some Matrix-like music playing in the background. I wasn‚Äôt ‚Äúborn to code‚Äù. If anything, I spent a good chunk of my early dev life asking Google questions like ‚ÄúWhat's the most interesting career?‚Äù and "How do i know what to pursue?‚Äù
This post? It‚Äôs personal. I wanted to write this now, while everything‚Äôs still raw and messy and in-progress. This is my version of leaving breadcrumbs.
So yeah! here‚Äôs how I got here, and where I‚Äôm headed next.
When I first got curious about tech, I didn‚Äôt even know where to begin. I just knew I liked breaking things and figuring out why they bro‚Ä¶
articles.title: Where it all started.

articles.author: Mati
articles.description:
Back in July 2024, I published my last post on this blog. Since then, I‚Äôve been quiet ‚Äî at least here. Behind the scenes, I‚Äôve been busy building something I‚Äôve wanted for a long time: a dedicated platform for Ruby developers to stay up to date, share resources, and connect.
That platform is ActiveRubyist.com, and in this post, I‚Äôll walk you through what it‚Äôs become, how it started, what I‚Äôve learned from building it solo ‚Äî and where it‚Äôs heading next.
The idea for ActiveRubyist was born around mid-2023. I was starting a new job and found myself wishing for a central place to keep up with news, tutorials, blog posts, and tools from the Ruby and Rails ecosystem.
The first version of ActiveRubyist was extremely simple ‚Äî it pulled content from a handful of RSS feeds and presented them in a ba‚Ä¶
articles.title: What I learned while building ActiveRubyist

articles.author: Mircea Cadariu
articles.description:
Having explicit limits in place for everything, is a really good thing. You want to have rate limiting set up to ensure fair use and prevent operational headaches. For example, you see it omnipresent with LLM providers. You witnessed the concept in the "real world" as well - in some more busy restaurants, you have only a limited time slot in which to enjoy being seated at a table. 
In this post, I'll show you how to add rate limiting to a Spring Boot application. For the book-keeping required to make it work, we will be using TigerBeetle, a new financial transactions OLTP database. In case you haven't heard about it already, I'm sure you'll find it quite interesting from the perspective of what it can do and how it's built. As a bonus, I'll show you how to capture and visualise rate limiti‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to add rate limiting to a Spring Boot app using TigerBeetle

articles.author: wispy
articles.description:
Introduction


In this tutorial, you‚Äôll learn how to generate your Orderly Account ID ‚Äî a crucial step to authenticate yourself and use their private APIs.
Before you can sign requests or integrate trading features with Orderly, you need this unique identifier linked to your wallet and the broker you‚Äôre working with.
We‚Äôll go over what Orderly is, why the Account ID matters, and how to generate it step by step using JavaScript.
Orderly is a decentralized trading infrastructure (DEX infra) that combines the efficiency of a centralized exchange (CEX) with the transparency and self-custody of DeFi. It doesn‚Äôt have its own user interface; instead, it provides an order engine and a liquidity layer that can be easily integrated by other projects.
Thanks to its modular design, developers can buil‚Ä¶
articles.title: Quick Guide: Create Your Account ID on Orderly

articles.author: Kevin Juli√°n Mart√≠nez Escobar
articles.description:
The recent announcement titled "Wake up, Remix!" has sparked a lot of reactions across the developer community. It‚Äôs natural to have questions about the future of Remix and React Router. But here‚Äôs the key point: React Router v7 is a stable, production-ready platform backed by a committed team that will continue maintaining and improving it.
React Router v7 was designed to offer a robust and up-to-date experience. This version includes many of the advanced features that made Remix stand out, such as:
Server-side rendering (SSR) and static site generation (SSG): Enabling faster, SEO-friendly applications.
Simplified data loading and server actions: Making it easier to manage data and forms in a declarative way.
These features make React Router v7 a strong choice for building modern applicat‚Ä¶
articles.title: React Router v7 Remains Strong: Clarity After the ‚ÄúWake up, Remix!‚Äù Announcement
